docsTags.name: virtualProp
docsTags.text: {"ios" | "md"} mode - The mode determines which platform styles to use.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: label - The label text to associate with the textarea. Use the `labelPlacement` property to control where the label is placed relative to the textarea. Use this if you need to render a label with custom HTML. (EXPERIMENTAL)

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: start - Content to display at the leading edge of the textarea. (EXPERIMENTAL)

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: end - Content to display at the trailing edge of the textarea. (EXPERIMENTAL)

props.name: autoGrow
props.docs:
If `true`, the textarea container will grow and shrink based
on the contents of the textarea.

props.name: autocapitalize
props.docs:
Indicates whether and how the text value should be automatically capitalized as it is entered/edited by the user.
Available options: `"off"`, `"none"`, `"on"`, `"sentences"`, `"words"`, `"characters"`.

props.name: autofocus
props.docs:
Sets the [`autofocus` attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/autofocus) on the native input element.

This may not be sufficient for the element to be focused on page load. See [managing focus](/docs/developing/managing-focus) for more information.

props.name: clearOnEdit
props.docs: If `true`, the value will be cleared after focus upon edit.

props.name: color
props.docs:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

props.name: cols
props.docs: The visible width of the text control, in average character widths. If it is specified, it must be a positive integer.

props.name: counter
props.docs:
If `true`, a character counter will display the ratio of characters used and the total character limit.
Developers must also set the `maxlength` property for the counter to be calculated correctly.

props.name: counterFormatter
props.docs:
A callback used to format the counter text.
By default the counter text is set to "itemLength / maxLength".

See https://ionicframework.com/docs/troubleshooting/runtime#accessing-this
if you need to access `this` from within the callback.

props.name: debounce
props.docs: Set the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait to trigger the `ionInput` event after each keystroke.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the textarea.

props.name: enterkeyhint
props.docs:
A hint to the browser for which enter key to display.
Possible values: `"enter"`, `"done"`, `"go"`, `"next"`,
`"previous"`, `"search"`, and `"send"`.

props.name: errorText
props.docs: Text that is placed under the textarea and displayed when an error is detected.

props.name: fill
props.docs:
The fill for the item. If `"solid"` the item will have a background. If
`"outline"` the item will be transparent with a border. Only available in `md` mode.

props.name: helperText
props.docs: Text that is placed under the textarea and displayed when no error is detected.

props.name: inputmode
props.docs:
A hint to the browser for which keyboard to display.
Possible values: `"none"`, `"text"`, `"tel"`, `"url"`,
`"email"`, `"numeric"`, `"decimal"`, and `"search"`.

props.name: label
props.docs:
The visible label associated with the textarea.

Use this if you need to render a plaintext label.

The `label` property will take priority over the `label` slot if both are used.

props.name: labelPlacement
props.docs:
Where to place the label relative to the textarea.
`"start"`: The label will appear to the left of the textarea in LTR and to the right in RTL.
`"end"`: The label will appear to the right of the textarea in LTR and to the left in RTL.
`"floating"`: The label will appear smaller and above the textarea when the textarea is focused or it has a value. Otherwise it will appear on top of the textarea.
`"stacked"`: The label will appear smaller and above the textarea regardless even when the textarea is blurred or has no value.
`"fixed"`: The label has the same behavior as `"start"` except it also has a fixed width. Long text will be truncated with ellipses ("...").

props.name: maxlength
props.docs: This attribute specifies the maximum number of characters that the user can enter.

props.name: minlength
props.docs: This attribute specifies the minimum number of characters that the user can enter.

props.name: mode
props.docs: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

props.name: name
props.docs: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

props.name: placeholder
props.docs: Instructional text that shows before the input has a value.

props.name: readonly
props.docs: If `true`, the user cannot modify the value.

props.name: required
props.docs: If `true`, the user must fill in a value before submitting a form.

props.name: rows
props.docs: The number of visible text lines for the control.

props.name: shape
props.docs: The shape of the textarea. If "round" it will have an increased border radius.

props.name: spellcheck
props.docs: If `true`, the element will have its spelling and grammar checked.

props.name: value
props.docs: The value of the textarea.

props.name: wrap
props.docs: Indicates how the control wraps text.

methods.name: getInputElement
methods.docs: Returns the native `<textarea>` element used under the hood.

methods.name: setFocus
methods.docs:
Sets focus on the native `textarea` in `ion-textarea`. Use this method instead of the global
`textarea.focus()`.

See [managing focus](/docs/developing/managing-focus) for more information.

events.docs: Emitted when the input loses focus.

The `ionChange` event is fired when the user modifies the textarea's value.
Unlike the `ionInput` event, the `ionChange` event is fired when
the element loses focus after its value has been modified.

This event will not emit when programmatically setting the `value` property.
Emitted when the input has focus.

The `ionInput` event is fired each time the user modifies the textarea's value.
Unlike the `ionChange` event, the `ionInput` event is fired for each alteration
to the textarea's value. This typically happens for each keystroke as the user types.

When `clearOnEdit` is enabled, the `ionInput` event will be fired when
the user clears the textarea by performing a keydown event.
